lines.text: How dare you... How dare you... How dare you scar a young girl's face!
It's perfect... Perfect! A-ko, you're going to die... die... DIE!
[the Captain is having D.T.'s and shooting wildly]
Booze! I need booze! Booze! Booze-booze-booze-booze-booze!

Who, why, what. Tank-ku-chi? Consequently it is the "We Are The World" of the Muromachi Period. At daybreak, the H2O is a fermata. Love in your Sigma Z. The path of love is always of the Rias type. To the side! To the side! A tank is passing...

[teaching class]
When the poet says "Oh,to substantialize this supasataitias ontelogical quitity." he is expressing something that I think you'll agree is central to most people's lives.At the same time,what does it tell us about his absurdest views of human existence?A good question.Then his obsession with ecumenical transcendentalism is revealing.

Is that all you can think about? Being a good little girl and charming the teachers? Well, naturally it never occurred to you that some of us aren't born with the same charm! But you don't care; you're always the good little heroine, while I have to be the one everyone said was spoiled! Okay, if people say I'm the bad girl, then that's what I'm gonna be!
I ain't no boy just because I shave everyday. You gotta be initiated which you might find painful!
